content.heading: Mechanical Color
content.content: Design consulting for [power tools](#powertools), [audio gear](#audiogear), [educational toys](#educationaltoys), a [robot](#robot), a [hibachi grill](#hibachigrill), a [cooler](#cooler), [headphones](#headphones), [faucets](#faucets), [toilets](#toilets), [flush valves](#flushvalves), a [sci-fi movie vehicle](#scifi), [coffee makers](#coffeemakers), a [panini maker](#paninimaker), and a [lint roller](#lintroller). Created marketing product photography for [video game consoles](#xboxone), [drones](#drones), [golf clubs](#golfclubs), [medical devices](#medical), and a [scrubber thingy](#scrubber).

content.heading: Bose
content.content: Developed user stories and prototypes for radical new product ideas, and served as an internal consulting group supporting design efforts in home entertainment, noise reduction technology, automotive, and professional audio products. Emphasis on technology, performance, and ease of use.

content.content: Designed [power tools](#powertools) for mass market, especially the [VPX product line](#vpx). Special emphasis on design for manufacturability, cost, and visual brand language development.

content.content: Designed and implemented the MODO 801/901 "Interactive Showcase", giving new users clear and concise access to important information, inspirational materials, and tutorials. Worked internally with The Foundry to develop products and plugins for the design market.

content.heading: University of Oxford
content.content: Studied research methodologies for design history. Wrote about the concept of 'authorship' in the age of 3D-printed guns, the Machine Age in America from the seat of a Farmall tractor, collective memory of World War II as illustrated by The Flying Tigers, the confusion caused by the misuse of the word "function," and, finally, the problematic term "authenticity" as viewed through a pair of cheap sunglasses.

content.content: Studied core Industrial (product) Design curriculum, classical drawing/painting, printmaking, ceramics, glass blowing, welding, bronze casting, and Making Stuff Out Of Duck Tape.

content.heading: Life
content.content: My wife is an Art Conservator specializing in archaeological and ethnographic objects. Our daughter is {January 3, 2014}(yearsSince) years old. We love to travel, hike big mountains, read nerdy books, play board games, sing silly songs, and cook yummy food. Hobbies include carpentry, playing drums/guitar/mandolin, juggling swords (true story), and making weird faces in front of a mirror.
